headline.main: Alcoholism Cost to Nation Put at $25-Billion a Year; ALCOHOLISM COST PUT AT 25-BILLION ' A Great Distinction'

byline.original: By HAROLD M. SCHMECK Jr.Special to The new York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: coholism and related problems are costing the nation more than $25-billion a year, and most American youth are drinking at least occasionally, according to a major report on alcohol and health that was made public today.
docs.snippet: coholism and related problems are costing the nation more than $25-billion a year, and most American youth are drinking at least occasionally, according to a major report on alcohol and health that was made public today.
